business.headline: India's income inequality now worse than British era, says financial analystThe divide between India's rich and poor is bigger than ever, with almost half the people surviving on very little, while a privileged few hold most of the wealth, says Hardik Joshi, a financial analyst.

HDFC Bank CEO moves Supreme Court against Lilavati Hospital FIRThe clash between one of India's largest private banks and a big Mumbai hospital is linked to a financial transaction, but the exact details of the FIR or the amount involved were not shared in court.

Lost your ITR login? Here's how to file income tax using net bankingIf you can't remember your Income Tax portal password, you don't need to reset it straight away. Most major banks in India allow you to access the e-Filing portal through their net banking services. It's a safe and easy way to file your return on time.

Axis Bank, Nestle India set dividend record dates; last day to buy shares todayNestle India and Axis Bank have fixed July 4 as the record date, which will decide who is eligible to receive the dividend payouts.

Inside China's quiet move to disrupt iPhone production in IndiaThe latest model, the iPhone 17, was to be a huge step in Apple's plans to make India its second home for high-end production. That roadmap now looks uncertain as Foxconn has pulled out Chinese staff.

Who is Soham Parekh, Indian techie who worked at 4-5 US startups at same time?Soham Parekh, who is believed to be based in India, is alleged to have simultaneously worked at up to four or five startups—many of them backed by Y Combinator—raising questions about hiring practices in remote-first tech culture.
Sensex, Nifty struggle for direction as markets await India-US deal newsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 13.01 points to 83,396.68, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 3.70 points to 25,449.70 as of 9:29 am.
Will Sensex, Nifty open higher amid US–Vietnam trade deal impact?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,584 points at 8:18 am, suggesting an increase from the previous close of 25,574.50.

Stocks to watch on July 3: Nykaa, RVNL, Nestle, Yes Bank, Dmart, PNBInvestors are now watching company announcements for the April–June quarter results, while developments related to a possible trade deal between India and the United States are also being closely followed.

Retiring without children? Here's how to plan for a comfortable and secure futureToday, more and more Indians are choosing to remain child-free or find themselves without direct heirs for various reasons. For them, retirement planning isn't just about saving money and building a corpus, it's about securing comfort, care, dignity, and independence in their golden years.

Sensex ends 288 points lower, Nifty settles below 25, 500; Tata Steel down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 287.60 points to end at 83,409.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.40 points to end at 25,453.40.

Need your UAN? Here's how to get it and manage your PF smoothlyThe biggest advantage of a UAN is its permanence. It doesn't change when you change jobs. It ties together all your PF accounts, making fund tracking and management simple and paperless.

entertainment.headline: Deepika's honour is big, but she's not 1st Indian on Hollywood Walk of FameDeepika Padukone has been named a 2025 Hollywood Walk of Fame honouree. However, many don't know that the first Indian to receive this honour was Sabu Dastagir, a famous actor in Hollywood over 80 years ago.

Actor Mumtaz says Shammi Kapoor's wife doesn't like her talking about himMumtaz recently shared that she doesn't talk about Shammi Kapoor to avoid upsetting his wife, Neila Devi. The couple worked together on several Bollywood classics, and were also in a relationship.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu trailer event cancelled in Hyderabad due to huge fan gatheringThe trailer screening event for 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' at Hyderabad's Sandhya Theatre was cancelled due to an overwhelming turnout of fans raising safety concerns. Despite this, the trailer was released and screenings continued at other venues, generating excitement for the film's July 24 release.

Ramayana 1st glimpse out: Ranbir Kapoor, Yash, Sai Pallavi's film teases epic sagaThe first glimpse of Ranbir Kapoor's 'Ramayana' is finally out, offering a stunning visual spectacle. Directed by Nitesh Tiwari, the film also stars Sai Pallavi and Yash, and marks the beginning of a two-part epic.

Kamal Haasan's Thug Life releases on Netflix, a month after theatrical release'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and directed by Mani Ratnam, is now available on Netflix, streaming in five languages. The film began streaming on the platform 28 days after its theatrical release.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu trailer: Pawan Kalyan battles Bobby Deol in quest for dharmaThe trailer for 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu', starring Pawan Kalyan, promises a grand period action drama filled with powerful visuals and intense battle scenes. Bobby Deol plays a fierce villain in the film scheduled for release on July 24, 2025.

Kriti-Dhanush celebrate Tere Ishk Mein with cake, selfies, emotions. PicsKriti Sanon and Dhanush concluded the shooting for 'Tere Ishk Mein' with Aanand L Rai. The director shared insights and celebratory moments from their wrap-up party on social media. The film is set for release on November 28 this year.

Aamir Khan to be the chief guest at 16th Indian Film Festival of MelbourneAamir Khan will be the chief guest at the 16th edition of the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025, where a special retrospective will celebrate his iconic film career. His latest film, 'Sitaare Zameen Par', will be screened at the event.

Vijay Sethupathi hugs son Surya at premiere of his debut film, Phoenix. WatchVijay Sethupathi congratulated his son, Surya, and the team of his debut film, 'Phoenix'. A special premiere was arranged in Chennai on Thursday.

Kajol and Twinkle Khanna to host new chat show on OTT platform: ReportBollywood stars Kajol and Twinkle Khanna are reportedly joining forces for a new chat show. The show will reportedly feature prominent names from the film industry and will reportedly stream on Prime Video.

Kerala High Court to watch Janaki vs State of Kerala amid censorship controversyKerala High Court will watch Suresh Gopi and Anupama Parameswaran's 'Janaki Vs State of Kerala' on July 5. The Censor Board of Film Certification demanded a change of the film's title over objections to the use of the name Janaki as it refers to Goddess Sita.

Priyanka Chopra-Nick Jonas serve style goals at Wimbledon 2025 amid film promotionsPriyanka Chopra took a stylish break from promoting her Hollywood film 'Heads of State' to attend Wimbledon 2025 with husband Nick Jonas. Her latest film, also starring John Cena and Idris Alba, is streaming on Prime Video.

Ekta Kapoor reacts to Smriti Irani's claim of refusing Kyunki 2 in 2014Ekta Kapoor reacted to Smriti Irani's comment on refusing the sequel to 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' in 2014. The show's reboot was originally scheduled for July 3 this year, but has now been postponed.

KBC turns 25: Amitabh Bachchan-show was a media quake, says creator Siddhartha Basu'Kaun Banega Crorepati', which launched in 2000, revolutionised Indian television and revitalised Amitabh Bachchan's career. As it marked 25 years, its creator Siddhartha Basu reflected on the show's enduring appeal and its impact on countless lives across the nation.

Ramayana 1st glimpse today: Cast, budget, when and where to watch the epic promoThe much-anticipated Bollywood reimagining of 'Ramayana', featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi, promises to captivate audiences with its grand scale, ahead of its first glimpse reveal across nine Indian cities. Here's all you need to know ahead of the mega promo.

Ramayana actor Ranbir Kapoor delights fans with photo op in LondonRanbir Kapoor recently made fans' day by taking a photo with them during his holiday in London. The actor has finished shooting for 'Ramayana Part 1' and is currently on vacation with his wife Alia Bhatt, daughter Raha Kapoor and mother Neetu Kapoor.

KPop Demon Hunters' Saja Boys, Huntrix go global, Even BTS can't resist the hype'KPop Demon Hunters', a Netflix original, has captivated fans worldwide with its unique blend of K-pop culture and fantasy. BTS's endorsement has further boosted its popularity.

Singer Post Malone falls mid-show in Arizona, continues show unharmedSinger Post Malone fell off the stage during his performance at the Arizona concert. A fan captured the moment in the viral clip. The singer escaped unharmed during the incident.

Kartik Aaryan and Sreeleela step out for dinner, pose solo for paps. WatchKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela were seen dining out in Mumbai, stirring interest among fans. They recently wrapped up shooting for their romantic musical with Anurag Basu.

general news.headline: India says no one except Dalai Lama can decide his successor, snubs ChinaChina insisted the Dalai Lama's next reincarnation must follow Beijing laws, but the Tibetan leader's office asserted the Gaden Phodrang Trust alone holds the power to decide the Buddhist monk's successor.

Are you from BJP? Siddaramaiah snaps at reporter over cop's resignation questionKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah appeared visibly irritated after a reporter questioned him on Karnataka police officer's resignation. The ASP tendered his resignation and cited public rebuke by Siddaramaiah as humiliating.

Pak social media accounts banned again after 'tech glitch' leads to unblockingThe Instagram and Twitter profiles of Pakistani celebrities such as Hania Aamir, Shahid Afridi and Mahira Khan once again became inaccessible to Indian users.

Househelp murders woman, teen in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar after she scolds himThe main suspect, identified as Mukesh, 24, originally from Bihar and currently residing in nearby Amar Colony, was employed by the Sewanis as a driver and helper in their shop.

Inside China's quiet move to disrupt iPhone production in IndiaThe latest model, the iPhone 17, was to be a huge step in Apple's plans to make India its second home for high-end production. That roadmap now looks uncertain as Foxconn has pulled out Chinese staff.

Who is Soham Parekh, Indian techie who worked at 4-5 US startups at same time?Soham Parekh, who is believed to be based in India, is alleged to have simultaneously worked at up to four or five startups—many of them backed by Y Combinator—raising questions about hiring practices in remote-first tech culture.

Video: Staffer assaulted for refusing to provide extra cup at Bengaluru coffee shopFour men brutally assaulted a hotel staffer at a popular coffee shop in central Bengaluru for refusing to provide an extra cup.

Was suspension needed: Karnataka High Court on action against cop after stampedeDuring a hearing on the state's petition challenging the Central Administrative Tribunal's order, the Karnataka High Court questioned whether the suspension of IPS officer Vikash Kumar Vikash was justified for mere dereliction of duty.

Ramayana 1st glimpse out: Ranbir Kapoor, Yash, Sai Pallavi's film teases epic sagaThe first glimpse of Ranbir Kapoor's 'Ramayana' is finally out, offering a stunning visual spectacle. Directed by Nitesh Tiwari, the film also stars Sai Pallavi and Yash, and marks the beginning of a two-part epic.

'Delivery boy' rapes Pune woman in her flat, clicks selfie, leaves chilling textThe man left behind a threatening message on the woman's phone which read, "I will come again." The accused had also taken a selfie on her phone.

Young Indian created by Gandhis to avoid heat on Congress, ED tells courtThe ED has alleged that Young Indian fraudulently acquired assets worth Rs 2,000 crore of Associated Journals Limited (AJL), which published the National Herald newspaper.

Murdered ex-Karnataka top cop's daughter vandalises milk booth in BengaluruDaughter of former Karnataka DGP, who was murdered at his Bengaluru home in April, was detained by the police for creating public nuisance. She reportedly vandalised a milk booth near her home.

Snatching Diwali, giving sex-gang tag: Indians abroad reject South-Asian labelThe Indian diaspora in the UK and the US are rejecting the term 'South Asian', calling it reductive and misleading. They argue it erases India's distinct civilisational identity, lumps together vastly different communities, and leads to both cultural appropriation and unfair blame for organised crimes.

Soham Parekh memes and jokes crown him CEO of multitasking and mysterySeveral US-based startup founders alleged that Soham Parekh, apparently based in India, was secretly working at multiple places without informing any of them.

Ramdev's Patanjali barred from running misleading ads against Dabur ChyawanprashThe interim order passed by the Delhi High Court came on a petition filed by Dabur alleging that Patanjali was running disparaging ads against its products.

Rs 800 crore bonus? Top IITian Trapit Bansal joins Meta AI superintelligence teamTrapit Bansal, an IIT-Kanpur alumnus and former OpenAI researcher, has joined Meta's new AI superintelligence team, bringing his deep learning and reasoning expertise to Zuckerberg's ambitious frontier model effort.

India's Shubhanshu Shukla working on developing brain-computer in spaceThis device measures brain activity using near-infrared light. The goal is to see if astronauts can use their brain signals to interact with computers while in microgravity like on the International Space Station.

Disguised as rider, Maharashtra minister busts illegal bike taxis in MumbaiMinister booked a ride under an unknown name through the Rapido app and within ten minutes, a bike arrived at Shaheed Babu Genu Chowk in Mantralaya.

Trade deal with US likely in 48 hours, India firm on agriculture red lineSources said the negotiations were in the final stages, with India digging in its heels on its stance of not opening the agriculture and dairy sectors completely to the US.

Have to cross that bridge: Jaishankar on US plan to tax top Russian oil buyersThe new US bill, introduced in the Senate, proposes a 500% tariff on countries that import from Russia. India is a large importer of crude oil from Russia.

British YouTuber fakes his death to get Rs 4,300 refund from airline. But...British YouTuber Max Fosh documented the stunt in a video titled "I Technically Died" that has garnered over 18 lakh views so far.

Shubman Gill's symphony at Edgbaston: Abbey Road, not autotuneENG vs IND, 2nd Test: At Edgbaston, Shubman Gill crafted a well-compiled 114  not out off 216 balls, leading India's batting charge on a topsy-turvy day. Calm and unhurried, Gill batted with remarkable control to bring up his second century as Test captain in as many matches.

Did Mark Zuckerberg gatecrash Oval Office meeting? White House explains incidentMark Zuckerberg allegedly stepped into an Oval Office F-47 briefing in March but was told to wait outside over security concerns — a claim the White House denied, calling the incident 'mischaracterised'.
Kolkata rape accused Manojit Mishra's lawyer license cancelledThe Bar Council acted seven days after receiving a formal complaint regarding the incident.

sports.headline: Tennis is difficult: Emma Raducanu after Zverev sparks mental health chatEmma Raducanu opened up about the emotional toll of professional tennis amid Alexander Zverev's candid revelation, stressing the importance of mental resilience and support systems in a sport where defeat is more common than victory.

Watch: Ishan Kishan imitates Harbhajan Singh in rare County bowling chanceIshan Kishan has been enjoying his time in the UK. After hitting back-to-back fifties for Nottinghamshire in County Championships, Ishan entertained when he was given an opportunity to bowl on Wednesday, July 02.

ENG vs IND: Shubman Gill slots into No. 4 like he has always belongedOn a day that was dominated by Jasprit Bumrah being rested for the Edgbaston Test, Shubman Gill showed why he was the best man to take up the mantle and continue India's rich tradition of having the best players at No.4 in Tests.

Day 4 schedule: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner eye Round 3 berthsNormalcy returned to Wimbledon as top seeds comfortably won their second-round matches. Early exits by Paolini and others add drama ahead of Djokovic and Sinner's matches.

Ravindra Jadeja guiding India lower order vs England with intent: AaronENG vs IND: Ravindra Jadeja's composed 41* and a steady 99-run stand with skipper Shubman Gill helped India recover from a top-order collapse and end Day 1 of the Birmingham Test against England in a strong position.

Shubman Gill has been an amazing captain, says Yashasvi JaiswalENG vs IND, 2nd Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal praised captain Shubman Gill, who scored a dogged hundred off 199 balls. It was his back-to-back centuries for the Indian skipper, having scored one on his Test captaincy debut in Leeds.

What's Yashasvi Jaiswal's Achilles heel? Cheteshwar Pujara weighs inENG vs IND: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 87 runs off 107 balls as India posted 310 for five at Stumps on Day 1 of their second Test at the Edgbaston in Birmingham.

Chris Woakes not happy with close umpiring calls in Edgbaston TestENG vs IND: Chris Woakes was not happy with a couple of umpiring decisions that didn't go in his favour on the opening day of the second Test in Birmingham.

Tough talk, tame tactics: Gambhir faces heat over Edgbaston Test selection callsEngland vs India, 2nd Test: India head coach Gautam Gambhir's bold words after the Headingley Test defeat rang hollow at Edgbaston, where India's defensive team selection for the Edgbaston Test exposed a growing gap between his statements and actions.

Steve Smith back for second Test after speedy finger injury recoverySteve Smith is named in Australia's playing XI for the second Test against West Indies after a swift recovery from a dislocated finger. Australia will be playing in Grenada for the first time in Test cricket history.

Shubman Gill's symphony at Edgbaston: Abbey Road, not autotuneENG vs IND, 2nd Test: At Edgbaston, Shubman Gill crafted a well-compiled 114  not out off 216 balls, leading India's batting charge on a topsy-turvy day. Calm and unhurried, Gill batted with remarkable control to bring up his second century as Test captain in as many matches.

What's Yashasvi Jaiswal's Achilles heel? Cheteshwar Pujara weighs inENG vs IND: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 87 runs off 107 balls as India posted 310 for five at Stumps on Day 1 of their second Test at the Edgbaston in Birmingham.

Chris Woakes not happy with close umpiring calls in Edgbaston TestENG vs IND: Chris Woakes was not happy with a couple of umpiring decisions that didn't go in his favour on the opening day of the second Test in Birmingham.

Tough talk, tame tactics: Gambhir faces heat over Edgbaston Test selection callsEngland vs India, 2nd Test: India head coach Gautam Gambhir's bold words after the Headingley Test defeat rang hollow at Edgbaston, where India's defensive team selection for the Edgbaston Test exposed a growing gap between his statements and actions.

Steve Smith back for second Test after speedy finger injury recoverySteve Smith is named in Australia's playing XI for the second Test against West Indies after a swift recovery from a dislocated finger. Australia will be playing in Grenada for the first time in Test cricket history.

Shubman Gill's symphony at Edgbaston: Abbey Road, not autotuneENG vs IND, 2nd Test: At Edgbaston, Shubman Gill crafted a well-compiled 114  not out off 216 balls, leading India's batting charge on a topsy-turvy day. Calm and unhurried, Gill batted with remarkable control to bring up his second century as Test captain in as many matches.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
